# wset_cover_ILP { #geomcover.cover.wset_cover_ILP }

`cover.wset_cover_ILP(subsets, weights, solver='highs')`

Computes an approximate solution to the weighted set cover problem via *integer linear programming*.

## Parameters

| Name      | Type      | Description                                                                 | Default    |
|-----------|-----------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `subsets` | sparray   | (n x J) sparse matrix of J subsets whose union forms a cover over n points. | _required_ |
| `weights` | ArrayLike | (J)-length array of subset weights.                                         | _required_ |
| `solver`  | str       | which MILP solver to use. Defaults to the HiGHS solver in SciPy.            | `'highs'`  |

## Returns

| Type   | Description                                                                                    |
|--------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| tuple  | (s, c) where s is a boolean array indicating which subsets are in the cover and c is its cost. |
